domain_objective_5_security_program_mana.question_text: Greg wants to classify anomalous behavior he has observed. The behavior involves a user’s  workstation sending large volumes of data to an off- site web server. How should he classify  this behavior?
domain_objective_5_security_program_mana.answer_text: Until he knows more details, Greg should classify this behavior as unexpected. Sending large volumes of data may be intentional, could be legitimate and thus not risky, and if it is intentional and part of business needs, would not be an insider threat.

domain_objective_5_security_program_mana.question_text: Amber is responsible for compliance with PCI DSS in her organization and wants to ensure  that she meets ongoing compliance monitoring requirements. Which of the following  options will best help her achieve ongoing compliance?
domain_objective_5_security_program_mana.choice_b: B. Use compliance monitoring capabilities in scanning and management tools.
domain_objective_5_security_program_mana.choice_c: C. Conduct regular training on compliance requirements.
domain_objective_5_security_program_mana.choice_d: D. Require an auditor’s attestation of compliance.
domain_objective_5_security_program_mana.answer_text: Using existing tools to monitor for changes that would move the organization out of compliance is a common practice to help ensure ongoing compliance. Quarterly audits are point- in- time checks and won’t ensure ongoing compliance. Training helps to keep staff aware, but additional actions are required to ensure compliance, and attestation does not provide ongoing compliance, only a statement at a point in time.

domain_objective_5_security_program_mana.question_text: The third- party auditors that Dion hired for his organization have completed their audit.  What action does the audit firm take after management acknowledgment is received from  Dion’s company?
domain_objective_5_security_program_mana.choice_a: A. Compliance reports are sent to third parties.
domain_objective_5_security_program_mana.choice_b: B. Regulatory statements are sent to customers.
domain_objective_5_security_program_mana.choice_c: C. Attestation is provided by the auditor.
domain_objective_5_security_program_mana.choice_d: D. Follow- up vulnerability scans will validate findings.
domain_objective_5_security_program_mana.answer_text: After audits are acknowledged by management, the auditors will attest that the audit is complete and accurate based on their work and knowledge. Compliance and regulatory reporting may or may not happen depending on the reasons for the audit and the organiza-tion’s needs. Once an audit is complete, further scans and other work may be conducted by the company but are not guaranteed.

domain_objective_5_security_program_mana.question_text: Latisha is conducting a security review and notices that one of her users consistently uses  her organization’s VPN from Chile while the employee is based in the United States. After  reviewing logs, she notes that the user is sometimes logged in from both the US and the  remote location in Chile, and believes that the user may be allowing a third party to access  their VPN account to perform some or all of their job tasks. What type of threat most accu- rately describes this?
domain_objective_5_security_program_mana.answer_text: The employee at Latisha’s company can be considered an insider threat because they have provided access to a third party. Most organizations will terminate employees who do this due to violations of their acceptable use policy (AUP). The behavior is anomalous, but an insider threat is a better description. No social engineering is evident, nor is a nation- state actor described.

domain_objective_5_security_program_mana.question_text: Marzita wants to respond to a phishing campaign that is sending links to malware to orga- nizations. What effective tactic can she use to react to these campaigns quickly?
domain_objective_5_security_program_mana.choice_a: A. Deploy a WAF to block suspicious links.
domain_objective_5_security_program_mana.choice_b: B. Subscribe to a threat feed and automatically block phishing campaign URLs.
domain_objective_5_security_program_mana.choice_c: C. Manually block phishing URLs as they are reported by users.
domain_objective_5_security_program_mana.answer_text: Using threat feeds to block phishing campaign URLs as they enter the feed is a proactive way to quickly respond. Web application firewalls (WAFs) are used to protect applications rather than as border devices to block outbound traffic. Manual blocks are commonly used but are slower to implement than threat feed–based responses. Conducting user awareness training is a best practice but doesn’t directly respond to campaigns.

domain_objective_5_security_program_mana.question_text: Amanda discovers that a member of her organization’s staff has installed a remote access  Trojan on their accounting software server and has been accessing it remotely. What type of  threat has she discovered?
domain_objective_5_security_program_mana.answer_text: Amanda has discovered an insider threat. Insider threats can be difficult to discover, as a malicious administrator or other privileged user will often have the ability to conceal their actions or may actually be the person tasked with hunting for threats like this! This is not a zero- day— no vulnerability was mentioned, there was no misconfiguration since this was an intentional action, and encryption is not mentioned or discussed.

domain_objective_5_security_program_mana.question_text: Phil recently received an email claiming to be from HR with a link to a list of every employ- ee’s compensation attached. Phil clicks on it without checking the URL because he is curious  about the pay that others in his department receive. How would this behavior be classified?
domain_objective_5_security_program_mana.answer_text: Behavior like this would be considered risky, as clicking on unknown, unexpected links is a common way to succumb to a phishing attack. Unexpected typically describes behavior that isn’t typical for the user, and we do now know if this user typically behaves this way. The Security+ exam outline doesn’t use irresponsible as a category, and the click was intentional.

domain_objective_5_security_program_mana.question_text: What should Ben do if he wants to assess the initial state of his information security  awareness?
domain_objective_5_security_program_mana.choice_a: A. Implement security awareness based on a standard like ISO 27001.
domain_objective_5_security_program_mana.choice_b: B. Conduct a baseline analysis to determine his starting state.
domain_objective_5_security_program_mana.choice_c: C. Implement security awareness based on NIST standards.
domain_objective_5_security_program_mana.choice_d: D. Conduct a penetration test to determine how staff respond to security issues.
domain_objective_5_security_program_mana.answer_text: Establishing a baseline for security awareness is important so that Ben can determine what, if any, impact a program is having. This will drive KPIs as well as influence which actions and steps are taken to evolve the program. Implementing a security program is recommended by many standards, but they don’t determine initial awareness state. Penetra-tion tests can provide information about where issues lie but don’t provide a broad baseline assessment either.

domain_objective_5_security_program_mana.question_text: During an incident investigation, Naomi notices that a second keyboard was plugged into a  system in a public area of her company’s building. Shortly after that event, the system was  infected with malware, resulting in a data breach. What should Naomi look for in her in-  person investigation?
domain_objective_5_security_program_mana.choice_b: B. A malicious USB cable or drive
domain_objective_5_security_program_mana.answer_text: Malicious tools like BadUSB can make a USB cable or drive look like a keyboard when they are plugged in. Malicious thumb drives have been used by penetration testers simply by dropping them in a parking lot near their intended target. A Trojan or a worm is a pos-sibility, but the clue involving the keyboard would point to a USB device as the first place Naomi should look.

domain_objective_5_security_program_mana.question_text: Jill wants to train her users to appropriately respond to suspicious email messages. Which of  the following will provide her organization with the most useful input from users?
domain_objective_5_security_program_mana.choice_a: A. Ask users to report the email to the email provider using a reporting button.
domain_objective_5_security_program_mana.choice_b: B. Ask users to report the email to an internal security team.
domain_objective_5_security_program_mana.choice_c: C. Ask users to delete the email to avoid further issues.
domain_objective_5_security_program_mana.choice_d: D. Ask users to click on the message and links to explore the potential security issue.
domain_objective_5_security_program_mana.answer_text: A common practice is to report suspicious messages to an internal security team so that they can take action on phishing and other potential security issues. Reporting to third parties will not provide the same visibility, nor will deleting the messages. Asking users to click on messages works against security best practices!

domain_objective_5_security_program_mana.question_text: Marcia wants to assess the effectiveness of her security awareness program. What  should she do?
domain_objective_5_security_program_mana.choice_a: A. Establish and monitor awareness KPIs.
domain_objective_5_security_program_mana.choice_b: B. Require a third- party awareness audit.
domain_objective_5_security_program_mana.choice_c: C. Conduct regular surveys about security awareness.
domain_objective_5_security_program_mana.choice_d: D. Track incident rates versus training participation.
domain_objective_5_security_program_mana.answer_text: Establishing security awareness KPIs, including incident rates, training uptake, responses to security awareness surveys, and other measurable indicators, is both the broadest and most useful option listed. Third- party awareness audits are not a typical method for doing this, and conducting surveys and tracking incident rates are both actions that will be part of common awareness KPIs.

domain_objective_5_security_program_mana.question_text: Myles wants to describe the impact of noncompliance with regulations on his organization’s  business. If his organization is not compliant, what impact is most likely to occur related to  his customers?
domain_objective_5_security_program_mana.answer_text: Myles should be concerned about contractual impacts as part of his customer relation-ships. Noncompliance with regulations is likely to make him unable to fulfill contracts or to be in violation of contractual terms that require his company to be in compliance. Fines, loss of license, and sanctions may also occur, but they are less directly impactful to cus-tomers and are not guaranteed.

domain_objective_5_security_program_mana.question_text: Sabrina wants to train her users on password management best practices. Which of the fol- lowing options will have the largest impact on her organization’s password security?
domain_objective_5_security_program_mana.choice_b: B. Conducting annual training on password best practices
domain_objective_5_security_program_mana.choice_c: C. Adopting NIST password length and complexity standards
domain_objective_5_security_program_mana.choice_d: D. Requiring staff to use an enterprise password manager
domain_objective_5_security_program_mana.answer_text: An enterprise password manager can help to make it easier to use appropriate pass-words without requiring users to memorize them. This results in less reuse, stronger pass-words, and the ability to manage them, including preventing password reuse. Biometrics, training, and adopting NIST password complexity and length standards will not have the same broad impact.

domain_objective_5_security_program_mana.question_text: Jill wants to explain her organization’s risks to senior management, but she knows that the  risk register is lengthy and detailed. What type of document is commonly used to convey the  most important high- level information found in a risk register to senior leaders?
domain_objective_5_security_program_mana.answer_text: Risk matrices are often used to summarize risk registers for senior management. SLE and ALE reports are not common documents, although ALE and SLE reports are com-monly used as part of quantitative risk assessment and reporting. Risk KPIs are used to track progress on risk management, not to provide a summary of a risk register.
domain_objective_5_security_program_mana.domain_objective: Domain Objective 5: Security Program Management And Oversight
